result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Sean Downey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence.

Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge by 60 DAYS.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all MANDATORY and NON-MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Sean Downey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Sean Downey in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Christopher Sean Downey.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence. 
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge by 60 DAYS.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waived all MANDATORY and NON-MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Christopher Sean Downey appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Christopher Sean Downey.  Prosecuting attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
